trail.Name: 10 Mile Brook Trail
trail.Description: 10 Mile Brook Trail is a pleasant walk or cycle out to 10 Mile Brook Dam, named after the tiny brook that was dammed in the mid-1990s to create a new supply of water for the quickly growing Margaret River and other townships.
trail.Contact: Department of Biodiversity, Conservation and Attractions, Parks and Wildlife Service - (08) 9840 0400

trail.Name: Baigup Wetland
trail.Description: This is an easy one kilometre walk along a sealed dual-purpose path through a Bush Forever site on the Swan River foreshore. Native vegetation and a variety of bush and water birds provide interest. Carpark, toilets, picnic area and playground near Garrett Road Bridge make an ideal family-friendly starting point.

trail.Name: Bells Rapids River Walk
trail.Description: An easy 2.5 kilometre loop walk at Bells Rapids - known for being one of the best vantage points on the Swan River for the Avon Descent event, with its majestic boulders and rushing waters in the winter.

trail.Name: Blackboy Ridge
trail.Description: The hidden walk trail on this reserve is seasonally abundant in wildflowers ~ wattles, parrotbush, orchids… It boasts fantastic views across the valley from the lookout at the top of the trail. It is 1.5 km return and is steep in places.

trail.Name: Bluff Knoll
trail.Description: Located in the Stirling Range National Park, Bluff Knoll is the third highest and one of the most spectacular peaks in Western Australia. The trail features include abundant wildflowers, birdlife, reptiles, exceptional scenery and views of the Stirling Ranges and geological formations.
trail.Contact: Department of Biodiversity, Conservation and Attractions, Parks and Wildlife Service - 08 9842 4500
